---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [7fb8b1a7e3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22925/commits/7fb8b1a7e32194a1f43002c505f05e8d7623d81c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.PlaceHolder.ToeplitzHausdorff_v2` (new file) `Mathlib.PlaceHolder.ToeplitzHausdorff` (new file)|1997|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_conj_eq_two_re`
`+ inner_eq_dot`
`+ inner_self_eq_dot`
`+ sum_complex_star`
`++ convex_set`
`++ numericalRange`
`++ toeplitz_hausdorff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (2.00, 1.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|2|2|bare open (scoped) Classical|

Current commit [7fb8b1a7e3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/7fb8b1a7e32194a1f43002c505f05e8d7623d81c)
Reference commit [3afb02999e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3afb02999e85360d098d4000c418f0f51d422091)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Hey @faenuccio thanks for the quick/early feedback! I made a little bit of an early mathematical mistake on the first proof so I ended up creating a v2 which I'm still fixing up. Feel free to go ahead and look at it if you're curious but also its fine to wait until I finish/clean it up. I'll ping you on zulip when I think it is ready
I have added several comments, as a first feedback.
I have added several comments, as a first feedback.
It would be better to remove these lines.
Why are you declaring `A` to be a global variable? It seems to me that in most lemmas you introduce it in the statement.

This is a very long proof, and it is much better to split it up into several lemmas. As a rule of thumb, you can consider than more than 15 lines of proof is long (of course there are exception, but this gives a rough idea).

Two points here:
1. `intros` is an old lean 3 syntax. Here `intro` would do; but
2. The tactic `rintro` decomposes the variables straight away to its constructor, so it would avoid you the subsequent `obtain`.
What's the point of introducing something which is already in scope? There is no difference between `eq_v` and `hv`.
You can type `<=` by `\leq` that results in `≤`.
Can you explain the mathematical idea that would lead to a contradiction?

The reason why you're stuck is that
1. you're trying to `rw` a RHS instead of a LHS. By default, `rw [h]` looks for the LHS of `h` in the goal and replaces it with the RHS. If you want to work in the other direction, the syntax is `rw [← h]`, where `←` is typed `\l`.
2. This wouldn't work at any rate. The problem is that in the goal you have `↑t`, which is the "coercion" of `t` to `ℂ` whereas in `exp2` the term `t` is really `t : ℝ`. To get rid of all coercions, you can do `norm_cast` before applying `rw [← exp2]`, and it will work.

pullRequest.title: ggranberry : WIP Toeplitz-Hausdorff
